main event: A civilian observed a round, blue flash of light that seemed to get brighter in Omaha, Nebraska on November 23, 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for an extended period and the object was stationary., The observer was returning home from the store when the sighting occurred., The report identified the object as a single round blue light., An astro plot shows Venus was in the southwest at the time of the sighting and approximately 30° above the horizon., Military communication noted that the object was possibly astronomical and referenced Venus.
sighted object: a round blue flash of light
